NATIONAL COALITION FOR LGBT HEALTH/HEALTHHIV: IMPACTFUL HIV PREVENTION AWARENESS - PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARYPROJECT TITLE: PARTNERING AND COMMUNICATING TOGETHER - CDC-RFA-PS21-2104APPLICANT NAME: NATIONAL COALITION FOR LGBT HEALTH - HEALTHHIVADDRESS: 2000 S STREET, NW; WASHINGTON, DC 20009PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR: BRIAN HUJDICHCONTACT PHONE NUMBERS: 202-507-4725PROJECT PERIOD: SEPTEMBER 30, 2021 ? SEPTEMBER 29, 2027FUNDING REQUEST: $227,376  THE NATIONAL COALITION FOR LGBT HEALTH (THE COALITION) PROPOSES TO SERVE AS A DYNAMIC AND EXCITING NEW PARTNER UNDER BOTH CATEGORY A: DIGITAL AND SOCIAL MEDIA AND CATEGORY B: EVENTS OUTLINED IN CDC?S NOTICE OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITY: PARTNERING AND COMMUNICATING TOGETHER  (CDC-RFA-PS21-2104). THE PACT NOFO AND THE LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER (LSHT) CAMPAIGN ALIGN WITH THE COALITION?S PURPOSE AND HEALTHHIV?S MISSION. THE COALITION ENGAGES A DIVERSE AND EXPANSIVE LGBTQ CONSTITUENCY (THE ESSENCE OF A COALITION) AND HEALTHHIV ENGAGES THE HIV COMMUNITY BY PUTTING HEALTH FIRST, JUST AS IN ITS NAME, AND ADDRESSING OVERALL HEALTH AND WELLNESS -- WITH THE SHARED GOAL OF STOPPING HIV TOGETHER AND ENDING THE HIV EPIDEMIC. THE COALITION IS MANAGED BY HEALTHHIV, A PREMIERE NATIONAL NON PROFIT WITH A PROVEN TRACK RECORD OF SUCCESS IN PARTNERSHIPS WITH CDC AND OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES. THE COALITION AND HEALTHHIV PROPOSE TO LEVERAGE EXISTING ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURES, NETWORKS, EVENTS, AND COMMUNICATION PLATFORMS TO DISSEMINATE LSHT CAMPAIGN RESOURCES/MESSAGING AND ENDING THE HIV EPIDEMIC (EHE) MESSAGING. THE COALITION WILL DEVELOP COMPELLING MESSAGING, VISUALS, AND PROGRAMMING  THAT ARE EVIDENCE BASED, POSITIVE, ENGAGING AND IMPACTFUL.TO MEET THE GOALS STATED IN THE NOFO AND LOGIC MODEL FOR CATEGORY A, THE COALITION PROPOSES A NUMBER OF NEW AND EXCITING DIGITAL AND SOCIAL MEDIA TACTICS FOR DISSEMINATION OF THE LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER CAMPAIGN THAT WILL ESTABLISHED AND WIDE-REACHING COMMUNICATIONS VEHICLES AS WELL AS NEW MEDIA, SUCH AS PODCASTS, VIDEOS, NEWS AND EMAIL BLASTS TO PRIORITY POPULATIONS. THE COALITION WI LL PROVIDE FAR-REACHING AND DYNAMIC COMMUNICATION OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS, DIGITAL ADVERTISEMENTS, AS WELL AS KEY BRANDING AND MARKETING INTEGRATIONS INTO THE COALITION?S AND HEALTHHIV?S WEBSITES, AND CUSTOMER RELATIONS MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS. THE COALITION HAS ALIGNED WITH NATIONAL PARTNERS, COMPOSED OF LGBTQ, MINORITY HEALTH AND HIV ORGANIZATIONS, AS WELL AS HISTORICALLY BLACK COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES, AND OTHERS TO DISSEMINATE LSHT AND EHE MATERIALS THROUGH THEIR OWN CONSTITUENCIES AND COMMUNICATIONS VEHICLES. TO MEET THE GOALS STATED IN THE NOFO FOR CATEGORY B, THE COALITION HAS PROPOSED A NUMBER OF IN-PERSON, VIRTUAL, AND HYBRID EVENTS AT WHICH LSHT CAMPAIGN MATERIALS, MESSAGING, AND OTHER CDC RESOURCES THAT SUPPORT HIV PREVENTION WILL BE FEATURED AND DISSEMINATED. WE INTEND TO PARTNER WITH THE COALITION?S MEMBERS, OUR OTHER PARTNERS, AND THE CDC TO HOST WEBINARS, PARTNER SUMMITS, AND WORKSHOPS.  THE COALITION WILL CAPITALIZE ON THE SUCCESS OF HEALTHHIV?S SYNCHRONICTY CONFERENCE, THE PREMIER NATIONAL CONFERENCE (AND YEAR LONG EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES) FOCUSING ON THE SYNDEMICS OF HIV, STI, AND VIRAL HEPATITIS ATTENDED BY OVER 2,000 INDIVIDUALS EACH YEAR, AS A KEY OPPORTUNITY FOR DISSEMINATING THE LSHT CAMPAIGN AND ITS MESSAGING TO DIVERSE AUDIENCES THROUGH SPECIAL SESSIONS, TRACK SESSIONS AND A UNIQUE LSHT PARTNERS SUMMIT, AND OTHER ACTIVITIES THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. THE COALITION ALSO WILL DISSEMINATE LSHT MESSAGING AT NUMEROUS PARTNERS? CONFERENCES, INCLUDING OASIS?S POSITIVELY HEALTHY CONFERENCE AND HOWARD UNIVERSITY?S NATIONAL HIV STIGMA CONFERENCE.

PACTO: STOPPING HIV IN COLLABORATION WITH HISPANIC-SERVING INSTITUTIONS - LATINOS ARE THE LARGEST ETHNIC MINORITY GROUP IN THE UNITED STATES (U.S.), COMPRISING 18% OF THEU.S. POPULATION IN 2019; REACHING 60 MILLION, THEY ARE THE FASTEST GROWING SEGMENT OF THEPOPULATION. LATINOS, AND PARTICULARLY LATINO SEXUAL AND GENDER MINORITIES, ARE AT INCREASED RISKFOR HIV INFECTION. LATINOS ACCOUNT FOR MORE THAN A QUARTER OF THE NEW DIAGNOSES OF HIV INFECTIONIN THE U.S. IN FACT, THE PREVALENCE RATE OF HIV INFECTION FOR LATINOS IN 2016 WAS 2.5 TIMES THAT OFNON-LATINO-WHITE, AND THE LIFETIME RISK FOR HIV DIAGNOSIS AMONG LATINOS IS OVER THREE TIMES THERATE OF NON-LATINO WHITE. LATINO POPULATIONS, PARTICULARLY THOSE LIVING IN PREDOMINANTLY LATINOCOMMUNITIES, SEXUAL AND GENDER MINORITIES, AND SPANISH-SPEAKING LATINOS ARE AT INCREASED RISKFOR INFECTION, YET VERY FEW HIV AWARENESS AND PREVENTION CAMPAIGN ARE AIMING THIS GROUP. IN THISPROJECT, WE AIM AT TO DISSEMINATE TOGETHER CAMPAIGN MATERIALS, MESSAGING, AND OTHER CDCRESOURCES THAT SUPPORT HIV PREVENTION AND IN PERSON AND VIRTUAL EVENTS IN PARTNERSHIP WITHHISPANIC-SERVING INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION AND THEIR COMMUNITIES. THE TEAM PROPOSING THEPROJECT HAS UNIQUE EXPERTISE AND ENTRY INTO THESE GROUPS AND ARE WELL POSITION TO COORDINATEEVENTS AND DELIVERY CONSISTENT, CULTURALLY APPROPRIATE HIV PREVENTION MESSAGES.

PARTNERING AND COMMUNICATING HIV AWARENESS AND PREVENTION THROUGH THE CENTER FOR BLACK HEALTH & EQUITY NETWORK - THE CENTER FOR BLACK HEALTH & EQUITY (THE CENTER) WILL UTILIZE OUR EXISTING MULTI-SECTOR NATIONAL HEALTH EQUITY NETWORK TO DISSEMINATE DIGITALLY AND AT IN-PERSON OR VIRTUAL EVENTS, CDC?S LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER (TOGETHER) MESSAGES AND CAMPAIGN MATERIALS.  THROUGH THE PARTNERING AND COMMUNICATING TOGETHER THROUGH THE CENTER NETWORK PROGRAM (PACT-CN) WE WILL TARGET TOGETHER CAMPAIGN MESSAGES AND COMMUNITY INTERVENTIONS FOR AFRICAN AMERICANS WHO BEAR A DISPROPORTIONATE BURDEN OF THE EFFECTS OF HIV.  OVER THE COURSE OF THIS GRANT, THE PACT-CN PROJECT WILL: 1) FORGE STRONG PARTNERSHIPS AND LINKAGES BETWEEN CDC-FUNDED HIV PROGRAMS AND AFRICAN AMERICAN COMMUNITIES; 2) DEVELOP AN INFRASTRUCTURE THAT FACILITATES A RECIPROCAL TRANSFER OF KNOWLEDGE BETWEEN AFRICAN AMERICAN COMMUNITIES AND CDC-FUNDED HIV PROGRAMS; AND 3) FACILITATE A NATIONAL DIALOGUE ON THE IMPORTANCE OF AFRICAN AMERICANS BEING SCREENED FOR HIV AND ELIMINATING STIGMA. THE HIV VIRUS. IN ADDITION TO WEEKLY COMMUNICATION WITH THE CENTER?S STRATEGIC PUBLIC HEALTH PARTNERS THROUGH EMAIL BLASTS, FACEBOOK, INSTAGRAM AND TWITTER POSTS, THE CENTER WILL HOST A SERIES OF GOOGLE CHATS, INSTAGRAM AND FACEBOOK LIVES WITH NATIONAL HIV EXPERTS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC TO CONTINUE SHARING INFORMATION ON HIV AND ITS IMPACT ON AFRICAN AMERICAN COMMUNITIES. IN COLLABORATION WITH OUR MEDIA AND OUTREACH PARTNERS SUCH AS THE BLACK AIDS INSTITUTE, AND THE BLACK LEADERSHIP ADVISORY COMMITTEE COMMISSION OF CRESCENT CARE HEALTH SYSTEMS, ACI 3 MEDIA, AND HEALTH IN HER HUE, WE WILL ALSO FACILITATE HIV TARGETED DISSEMINATION AT THE COMMUNITY, STATE AND NATIONAL LEVEL OF TOGETHER MESSAGING THROUGH MAJOR IN-PERSON AND VIRTUAL EVENTS.  OUR PARTNERS WILL WORK WITH US TO BOLSTER EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS AND DEVELOP NEW RELATIONSHIPS WITH STATE HEALTH DEPARTMENTS, LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, FAITH-BASED INSTITUTIONS, BALLROOM SPACES, AND HISTORICALLY BLACK COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES (HBCUS). OUR COORDINATED EFFORTS WILL INCREAS E HIV AWARENESS AMONG THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND REDUCE HIV INFECTIONS AMONG AFRICAN AMERICANS WITH A SPECIFIC EMPHASIS ON MSM, TRANS WOMEN, HETEROSEXUAL CISGENDER WOMEN.  THIS PROJECT IS INTENDED TO REACH ELEVEN OF THE PRIORITY JURISDICTIONS THAT THE ENDING THE HIV EPIDEMIC (EHE) PLAN HAS IDENTIFIED. AS A NATIONAL BLACK HEALTH EQUITY NETWORK WITH MULTIFACETED PARTNERS FROM VARIOUS SECTORS OF GOVERNMENT, CIVIC, FAITH-BASED AND LOCAL ENTITIES, THE CENTER IS IDEALLY POSITIONED TO RAISE AWARENESS AND EDUCATE OUR COMMUNITY OF THE IMPORTANCE OF HIV SCREENING AND THE RISK OF THIS DEADLY DISEASE IN AFRICAN AMERICAN COMMUNITIES.

SAVING FUTURE GENERATIONS HIV & FAITH ENGAGEMENT INITIATIVE - THE BALM IN GILEAD, INC PROPOSES TO CONDUCT A SERIES OF EVENTS TO DISSEMINATE LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER CAMPAIGNS AND OTHER CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (CDC) RESOURCES TO 201,936 AFRICAN AMERICANS RESIDENTS OF 13 COMMUNITIES IN FIVE CONTIGUOUS SOUTHERN STATES ? NORTH CAROLINA, SOUTH CAROLINA, GEORGIA, ALABAMA AND MISSISSIPPI.  AFRICAN AMERICANS IN THESE COMMUNITIES HAVE A DISPROPORTIONATELY HIGH RATE OF NEW HIV CASES. THEY ALSO SUFFER FROM MANY OF THE SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH SUCH AS POVERTY, THAT INCREASE THEIR RISK FOR HIV INFECTION. THE BALM WILL EMPLOY A FAITH-BASED APPROACH TO DISSEMINATION AND PARTNER THE HEALTH MINISTRIES OF 13 CONGREGATIONS THAT ARE PART OF THE AFRICAN AMERICAN DENOMINATIONAL LEADERSHIP HEALTH INITIATIVE (AADLHI) WHICH BRINGS TOGETHER THE HEALTH MINISTRIES OF THE AFRICAN METHODIST EPISCOPAL ZION CHURCH  (AMEZ) AND THE CHRISTIAN METHODIST EPISCOPAL CHURCH (CME).  THE BALM AND HEALTH MINISTRY STAFF WILL DESIGN A SERIES OF DISSEMINATION EVENTS FEATURING THE FOLLOWING TOGETHER TOPICS: PATIENT-CENTERED CARE,  GENERAL HIV PREVENTION;  PREVENTION COMMUNICATION; CONDOMS; PEP;  PREP;  STIGMA;  TESTING/SCREENING; SELF-TESTING; TREATMENT AND VIRAL SUPPRESSION. THE LIST OF EVENTS THAT WILL BE HELD DURING EACH PROJECT YEAR ARE: ?A WEBINAR SERIES FOR HEALTHCARE AND SOCIAL SERVICE PROVIDERS?REGIONAL HIV PREVENTION VIRTUAL SUMMIT ?26 VIRTUAL EVENTS TARGETING AFRICAN AMERICANS IN THE 13 PROJECT COMMUNITIES?26 IN-PERSON EVENTS THAT ENGAGE AFRICAN AMERICANS IN FAITH-BASED SETTINGS IN THE 13 PROJECT COMMUNITIES?13 VIRTUAL COMPETITIONS TARGETING AFRICAN AMERICAN YOUTH  IN THE 13 PROJECT COMMUNITIES?26 IN-PERSON HIV PREVENTION COMMUNITY EVENTS HELD IN COLLABORATION WITH LOCAL PARTNERS IN THE 13 PROJECT COMMUNITIES THE DESIRED OUTCOMES THAT WE WANT TO ACHIEVE BY 9/30/26 ARE AS FOLLOWS:?REACH 10% OF AFRICAN AMERICANS RESIDING IN THE TARGET COMMUNITIES WITH  LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER MESSAGES AND MATERIALS AND OTHER CDC RESOURCES  ?EXPOSE 100% OF ALL MINORITY-SERVING HEALTH CARE AND SOCIAL SERVICE PROVIDERS PRACTICING IN THE PROJECT?S TARGET AREAS LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER MESSAGES AND MATERIALS AND OTHER CDC RESOURCES ?INCREASE BY 25% THE NUMBER OF AFRICAN AMERICANS WHO SEEK HIV-RELATED INFORMATION FROM THE PROJECT. ?ENGAGE AT LEAST ONE LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCY, TWO COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, TWO HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS, AND ONE FAITH-BASED ORGANIZATION IN EACH  OF THE 13 TARGET COMMUNITIES  TO DISSEMINATE LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER MESSAGES AND MATERIALS?INCREASE BY 25% THE NUMBER OF AFRICAN AMERICANS IN THE TARGET COMMUNITIES WHO RECEIVE AN HIV TEST.

BLACK AIDS INSTITUTE LET'S STOP HIV TOGETHER - THE BLACK AIDS INSTITUTE (BAI) SEEKS, IN RESPONSE TO CDC-RFA-PS21-2104, TO INCREASE HIV AWARENESS AND OWNERSHIP IN BLACK COMMUNITIES AND TO SPUR INCREASED UPTAKE OF PRIORITY BIOMEDICAL PREVENTION AND TREATMENT TOOLS. TOWARDS THIS OVERARCHING GOAL, BAI WILL DISSEMINATE CDC?S LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER AT IN-PERSON AND VIRTUAL EVENTS. AS PART OF THE PROJECT, BAI WILL ALSO LEVERAGE DIVERSE PARTNERS AND NETWORK (BOTH HIV AND NON-HIV-SPECIFIC, AND BOTH CDC-FUNDED AND NON-CDC-FUNDED) TO DISSEMINATE LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER BROADLY ACROSS BLACK AMERICA. THIS PROJECT BUILDS ON BAI?S EXTENSIVE EXPERIENCE IN EVENT PLANNING, CAMPAIGN PROMOTION, STATE-OF-THE-ART COMMUNICATIONS, AND PARTNERSHIP CULTIVATION AND COLLABORATION.WORKING WITH PARTNERS, BAI EACH YEAR WILL DISSEMINATE CAMPAIGN MESSAGES AND MATERIALS AT 10 IN-PERSON AND 10 VIRTUAL EVENTS ? ALL OF THEM FOCUSED ON STATES AND COUNTIES PRIORITIZED FOR ACTION TOWARD ENDING THE HIV EPIDEMIC (EHE). DRAWING ON ITS EXISTING WORKING RELATIONSHIPS, BAI WILL PRIORITIZE DISSEMINATION OF LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER MESSAGES AND MATERIALS AT THE LARGEST NATIONAL AND REGIONAL GATHERINGS OF BLACK PEOPLE (E.G. ESSENCE MUSIC FESTIVAL, AFROPUNK FESTIVAL), HOMECOMING WEEKENDS AT HISTORICALLY BLACK COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES, GATHERINGS OF NATIONAL BLACK FRATERNITIES AND SORORITIES, AND BLACK PRIDE EVENTS. IN YEAR 1, BAI WILL PILOT ITS APPROACH AT A MAJOR NATIONAL EVENT, USING LESSONS LEARNED AND EVALUATION FINDINGS TO ADAPT ITS APPROACH, AS NEEDED.BAI?S APPROACH TO DISSEMINATION OF CAMPAIGN MATERIALS AND MESSAGES WILL BE TAILORED TO EACH EVENT. FOR MAJOR NATIONAL EVENTS, BAI WILL SECURE AN EXHIBIT BOOTH, PLACE AN ADVERTISEMENT IN THE EVENT PROGRAM, AND CO-BRAND CDC MATERIALS FOR DISTRIBUTION AT THE EVENT. AT EACH EVENT VENUE, BAI WILL RECRUIT A LOCAL HIV SERVICE ORGANIZATION TO PROVIDE HIV TESTING SERVICES TO EVENT ATTENDEES. FOR EACH EVENT, BAI WILL WORK WITH THE EVENT SPONSOR TO MAXIMIZE THE DISSEMINATION OF LET?S STOP HIV TOGE THER MESSAGES, INCLUDING THROUGH PLENARY SPEAKERS, PANEL DISCUSSIONS, AND PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENTS TO EVENT ATTENDEES. BAI WILL DRAW ON ITS 20-YEAR RECORD OF EVENT PLANNING TO IMPLEMENT TARGETED PROMOTIONAL EFFORTS TO MAXIMIZE EVENT ATTENDANCE. BAI WILL WORK WITH CDC TO CO-BRAND LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER MATERIALS AND LEVERAGE BAI?S IN-HOUSE DESIGN EXPERTISE TO DEVELOP DIGITAL DESIGN TEMPLATES FOR PROMOTIONAL MATERIALS. BAI WILL DEVELOP A DEDICATED WEB PAGE TO DRIVE BLACK AUDIENCES TO A SINGLE DESTINATION FOR ONGOING EVENTS INFORMATION, UPDATED MARKETING MATERIALS, AND ON-SITE EVENT VIDEOS AND PHOTOS. USING CDC MATERIALS AND BAI?S EVENT-SPECIFIC IMAGES ? AND LEVERAGING BAI?S SUBSTANTIAL AND RAPIDLY EXPANDING SOCIAL MEDIA PRESENCE ? BAI WILL PLACE FACEBOOK AND GOOGLE ADS TO PROMOTE EVENT ATTENDANCE. THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT, BAI WILL COLLABORATE WITH HEALTHCARE ORGANIZATIONS, HEALTH PROVIDERS ASSOCIATIONS, AND A MIX OF HIV- AND NON-HIV SOCIAL MEDIA SPACES (E.G. SOCIAL MEDIA HANDLES, INDIVIDUAL BLACK DIGITAL INFLUENCERS) TO PROMOTE EVENTS AND TO DISSEMINATE CAMPAIGN MESSAGES AND MATERIALS. BAI WILL EVALUATE AND REPORT ON PROGRESS TOWARD THE FOLLOWING PROJECT OUTCOMES:?INCREASE EXPOSURE TO CDC?S LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER CAMPAIGN MATERIALS AND MESSAGES AMONG PEOPLE DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED BY HIV, PEOPLE WITH HIV, AND HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS.?INCREASE HIV-RELATED INFORMATION SEEKING BEHAVIORS AMONG PEOPLE DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED BY HIV, PEOPLE WITH HIV, AND HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS.?INCREASE PARTNER ENGAGEMENT WITH CDC?S LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER MATERIALS AND MESSAGES.?INCREASE CROSS-COMMUNITY SUPPORT FOR HIV PREVENTION, TESTING AND REFERRAL SERVICES.?INCREASE HIV-RELATED COMMUNICATION AMONG ENGAGED PARTNERS AND NETWORKS.

TITLE: UTILIZING ROBUST COMMUNICATIONS AND PARTNERSHIP STRATEGIES TO AMPLIFY 'LET'S STOP HIV TOGETHER' CAMPAIGN AMONG VULNERABLE POPULATIONS - ABSTRACTTHROUGH THIS FUNDING OPPORTUNITY, THE ACPM AIMS TO LEVERAGE ITS EXPERIENCE AND BROAD NETWORK OF PREVENTIVE MEDICINE PHYSICIANS, PROFESSIONAL PARTNERSHIPS AND MULTI-MEDIA OUTREACH INFRASTRUCTURE TO BROADEN THE REACH AND PENETRANCE OF THE CDC?S LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER MESSAGING TO INCREASE HIV PREVENTION AWARENESS AND CONTRIBUTE TO REDUCING THE INCIDENCE OF HIV IN THE UNITED STATES, WITH PARTICULAR FOCUS ON VULNERABLE AFRICAN AMERICAN AND LATINX THE ACPM RECOGNIZES THE NEED FOR IMPROVED VISIBILITY AND INTEGRATION OF THE CDC?S HIV PREVENTION MESSAGING, PARTICULARLY WITHIN VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES AS WELL AS WITHIN PREVENTIVE MEDICINE AND PRIMARY CARE PRACTICES TREATING HIGH RISK POPULATIONS. THE ACPM AIMS TO ADDRESS THESE NEEDS BY: AIM 1: AMPLIFYING THE CDC?S LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER CAMPAIGN MESSAGING THROUGH A TARGETED, INFORMED DIGITAL AND SOCIAL MEDIA OUTREACH CAMPAIGNAIM 1A: MARSHALING ACPM?S EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS AND EXPERTISE AIM 2: LEVERAGING PARTNERSHIPS AND NETWORKS REPRESENTING COMMUNITIES OF INTEREST DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED BY HIV TO EXPAND THE REACH OF THE LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER CAMPAIGN AIM2A: PARTNERING WITH PREVENTIVE MEDICINE/PRIMARY CARE RESIDENCY PROGRAMS IN TWO SEPARATE HIGH RISK JURISDICTIONS IDENTIFIED BY THE CDC IN ITS ENDING THE HIV EPIDEMIC INITIATIVE. THE GOAL OF THESE PARTNERSHIPS WILL BE TO DEVELOP A PILOT PROGRAM THAT COULD SERVE AS A SCALABLE MODEL FOR PREVENTIVE MEDICINE PROGRAMS TO ADOPT AND ENHANCE RESIDENT TRAINEES? HIV PREVENTION PATHWAYS.ACPM WILL DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT TARGETED DISSEMINATION OF THE CDC?S LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER CAMPAIGN MATERIALS AND MESSAGING THROUGH DIGITAL AND SOCIAL MEDIA, LEVERAGING DIGITAL INFLUENCERS, PARTNERS AND NETWORKS TO:? INCREASE EXPOSURE TO LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER CAMPAIGN MATERIALS AMONG HIGH RISK POPULATIONS, BASED ON ESTABLISHED METRICS, BASED ON SMART PRINCIPLES (SPECIFIC, MEASAURABLE, ACTIONABLE, RELEVANT, TIMELY).? INCREASE INTEREST IN ACCESSING HIV MESSAGING AMONG PATIENTS AND PROVIDERS, BASED ON ESTABLISHED SMART METRICS:  TRACKING OF KEY INDICATORS ON ACPM?S WEBSITE; RELATED INQUIRIES TO THE ACPM PROJECT TEAM; PARTNER ORGANIZATION FEEDBACK? INCREASE ENGAGEMENT FROM ACPM PARTNERS WITH RESPECT TO LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER MESSAGING MATERIALS, BASED ON ESTABLISHED METRICS (REQUESTS FOR MATERIALS, ENGAGEMENT WITH ACPM HIV CAMPAIGN ?AMBASSADORS?)? INCREASE CROSS-COMMUNITY SUPPORT FOR HIV PREVENTION, TESTING AND REFERRAL SERVICESACPM WILL LEVERAGE PARTNERS, NETWORKS AND DIGITAL INFLUENCERS, REPRESENTING TARGETED COMMUNITIES, TO BROADEN THE REACH OF THE CDC?S LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER MESSAGING TO INCREASE  ENGAGEMENT FROM ACPM PARTNERS AND AFFILIATED ORGANIZATIONS TO AMPLIFY THE LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER CAMPAIGN MESSAGING, INCLUDING ENGAGEMENT OF TWO RESIDENCY PROGRAMS TO DEVELOP BEST PRACTICE MODELS FOR INTEGRATING HIV PREVENTION EDUCATION AND RESOURCES OFFERED THROUGH THE CDCS? LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER CAMPAIGN INTO MEDICAL AND COMMUNITY-BASED POINT-OF-CARE SETTINGS.

PACT - WE ARE UNITED - IN RESPONSE TO CDCS NOTICE OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITY ANNOUNCEMENT (NOFO), PARTNERING AND COMMUNICATING TOGETHER, AIDS UNITED (AU), IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE NATIONAL LGBTQ TASK FORCE, THE BLACK WOMEN?S IMPERATIVE, THE COLLABORATIVE TO ADVANCE HEALTH SERVICES, FIJATE BIEN/MPACT GLOBAL ACTION FOR GAY MEN?S HEALTH AND RIGHTS, AND BUILDING HEALTHY ONLINE COMMUNITIES SUBMIT A PROPOSAL TO BRING HIV PREVENTION AND AWARENESS MESSAGING TO KEY PRIORITY POPULATIONS AND AREAS ACROSS THE U.S. THIS APPLICATION FOR PACT ? WE ARE UNITED - IS SUBMITTED UNDER CATEGORY A AND B OF THE FUNDING ANNOUNCEMENT TO SUPPORT THE DISSEMINATION OF CDC?S LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER (TOGETHER) CAMPAIGN VIA THE USE OF DIGITAL AND SOCIAL MEDIA AND AT IN-PERSON AND VIRTUAL EVENTS. THE SCOPE OF STRATEGIES AND ACTIVITIES ARE DESIGNED TO REACH AND ENGAGE MSM, YOUNG MSM OF COLOR, TRANSGENDER WOMEN, HISPANIC/LATINX, AND COMMUNITIES IN SOUTHERN U.S. EVENTS ARE PLANNED TO TAKE PLACE IN TEN CRITICAL JURISDICTIONS IDENTIFIED BY THE ENDING THE HIV EPIDEMIC INITIATIVE (EHE) INCLUDING IN FLORIDA, GEORGIA, MISSOURI, MISSISSIPPI, NEW YORK, OHIO, SOUTH CAROLINA, TEXAS, WASHINGTON. D.C, AND PUERTO RICO. TODAY, WE HAVE REAL SOLUTIONS TO ADDRESS THE HIV EPIDEMIC IN THE US. YET, DESPITE ACCESS TO TREATMENT AND CARE, NEW ADVANCES IN TREATMENT, AND NEW PREVENTION MODALITIES SUCH AS PREP, 38,000 NEW HIV DIAGNOSES ARE REPORTED YEARLY WITH DISPROPORTIONATE IMPACT ON CERTAIN SECTORS OF THE POPULATION.  SOME OF THE CHALLENGES TO HIV PREVENTION AND TREATMENT CAN BE DIRECTLY LINKED TO LACK OF ACCURATE AND CURRENT KNOWLEDGE ABOUT HIV AND THE IMPACT OF STIGMA. GAPS IN KNOWLEDGE ALONG WITH INTERNAL NEGATIVE ATTITUDES, BEHAVIORS, AND JUDGEMENTS TOWARDS PEOPLE LIVING WITH OR AT RISK FOR HIV ARE LINKED TO DISCOURAGING INDIVIDUALS FROM LEARNING THEIR HIV STATUS, ACCESSING TREATMENT, OR STAYING IN CARE. ADDITIONALLY, EXPERIENCES OF RACISM AND DISCRIMINATION ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO ADDITIONAL BARRIERS IN HEALTHCARE AND, OFTEN, ARE  LINKED TO DISPARITIES ACCESSING IMPORTANT HIV PREVENTION TOOLS, INCLUDING PRESCRIPTION OF PREP.BUILDING UPON THE SUCCESSES OF THE CURRENT CDC FUNDED PACT PROGRAM (FORMERLY ACT AGAINST AIDS) THAT MOBILIZED NATIONAL AND LOCAL-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO HELP DELIVER HIV INFORMATION AND RESOURCES TO LGBTQ COMMUNITIES, AU WILL ENGAGE A BROADER AND TARGETED NETWORK OF NATIONAL, REGIONAL, AND LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS TO CONTINUE DISSEMINATING THE TOGETHER CAMPAIGN MESSAGING. WORKING SIDE-BY-SIDE WITH THE PARTNERING ORGANIZATIONS, ALONG WITH A NETWORK OF ONLINE COMMUNITIES ? AND UTILIZING DIGITAL, SOCIAL MEDIA, AND EVENTS ? WE PROPOSE TO DISSEMINATE HIV INFORMATION AND RAISE AWARENESS ABOUT HIV PREVENTION AND TREATMENT OPTIONS TO SPECIFIC AREAS AND POPULATIONS DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED BY HIV AND TO THEIR HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS. OUR PROPOSED PROGRAM WILL DISSEMINATE THE TOGETHER CAMPAIGN MESSAGES AND MATERIALS USING A COMPREHENSIVE COMMUNICATIONS PLAN TO INCLUDE TOGETHER-RELATED MESSAGES AND CONTENT IN SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS, BLOGS AND NEWSLETTERS, DIGITAL ARTICLES, AND SOCIAL MEDIA PLACEMENTS ACROSS VARIED PLATFORMS. FURTHERMORE, ACTIVITIES WILL ALSO INCLUDE TOGETHER DIGITAL AD PLACEMENTS AND STORIES GENERATED IN THE MEDIA, CAMPAIGN-RELATED MATERIAL DISTRIBUTION (MORE THAN 5000), AT LEAST 12 VIRTUAL AND 10 IN-PERSON EVENTS, CONTINUAL AD PLACEMENTS ON MSM DATING SITES, ENGAGEMENT OF NEW NATIONAL AND LOCAL PARTNERS, AND MUCH MORE. THESE EFFORTS AIM TO INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF OPTIONS TO PROMOTE HIV TESTING, ENCOURAGE EARLY ENGAGEMENT IN AND ADHERENCE TO HIV TREATMENT, AND INCREASE THE USE OF EFFECTIVE PREVENTION TOOLS, INCLUDING PREP (AMONG OTHERS) TO REDUCE NEW HIV RATES AMONG OUR TARGET POPULATIONS

LEVERAGE EXISTING ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE, NETWORKS, AND COMMUNICATION PLATFORMS TO DISSEMINATE CDC?S TOGETHER CAMPAIGN AMONG COLLEGE AGE YOUNG PEOPLE THROUGH DIGITAL AND SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS - ADVOCATES WILL LEVERAGE ITS EXISTING ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE, NETWORKS AND COMMUNICATION PLATFORMS TO DISSEMINATE CDC?S TOGETHER CAMPAIGN AMONG COLLEGE AGE YOUNG PEOPLE VIA THE USE OF ITS DIGITAL AND SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS. ADVOCATES WILL CONTRIBUTE TO CDC?S EFFORTS TO INCREASE HIV AWARENESS; REDUCE NEW HIV INFECTIONS AMONG BLACK/LATINX YOUNG PEOPLE, 18-24 WITH A FOCUS ON: MALE; FEMALE; TRANS MALE; TRANS FEMALE; AND GENDERQUEER/GENDER NON-CONFORMING YOUTH, AND IMPROVE THE HEALTH OUTCOMES FOR PEOPLE WITH HIV IN THE U.S. AND ITS TERRITORIES. ADVOCATES WILL INCREASE EXPOSURE TO CDC?S TOGETHER CAMPAIGN MATERIALS AND MESSAGES AMONG YOUNG PEOPLE DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED BY HIV, YOUNG PEOPLE LIVING WITH HIV, AND YOUTH-SERVING HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS; INCREASE HIV-RELATED INFORMATION SEEKING BEHAVIORS AMONG YOUNG PEOPLE DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED BY HIV, YOUNG PEOPLE LIVING WITH HIV, AND YOUTH-SERVING HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS; AND 3) INCREASE PARTNER ENGAGEMENT WITH CDC?S TOGETHER MATERIALS AND MESSAGES INCREASE CROSS-COMMUNITY SUPPORT FOR HIV PREVENTION, TESTING, AND REFERRAL STRATEGIES; AND INCREASE HIV-RELATED COMMUNICATION AMONG ENGAGED PARTNERS AND NETWORKS. ADVOCATES WILL ENGAGE BLACK AND LATINX LGBTQ YOUNG PEOPLE AGES 18-24, COMMUNITY PARTNERS AND ITS EXTENSIVE NETWORK OF YOUTH ACTIVISTS AND ADULT ALLIES. TACTICS INCLUDE SOCIAL MEDIA REACH TO PROMOTE/DISSEMINATE TOGETHER CAMPAIGN MATERIALS AND MESSAGES ON HIV/AIDS AND LGBTQ HEALTH AWARENESS DAYS; PARTNERING WITH THE CREATORS COUNCIL TO DEVELOP A SOCIAL MEDIA TOOLKIT, CREATE CONTENT FOR POSTS ON SOCIAL MEDIA CHANNELS THAT WILL INCLUDE OP-ED AND BLOG POSTS ON DIGITAL MEDIA SITES AND VIDEO AND VISUAL CONTENT ON MULTIPLE SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS AND HOST INTERACTIVE FACEBOOK AND INSTAGRAM LIVE EVENTS; INCORPORATING CAMPAIGN MATERIALS AND MESSAGING INTO WEBINARS, TRAININGS, CURRICULA AND ON THE WEBSITE; AND SENDING TEXT MESSAGES AND EMAILS TO ITS NETWORK OF 100,000 YOUNG PEOPLE.

REACH - NMAC (FORMERLY THE NATIONAL MINORITY AIDS COUNCIL) PROPOSES ?PROJECT REACH? IN RESPONSE TO THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION?S (CDC?S) NOTICE OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITY (NOFO) ?PARTNERING AND COMMUNICATING TOGETHER? (PACT) CDC-RFA-(PS21-2104). PROJECT REACH RESPONDS TO CATEGORY A, ?DIGITAL AND SOCIAL MEDIA,? OF THE NOFO AND WILL LEVERAGE NMAC?S NATIONAL LEADERSHIP IN THE COMMUNITIES MOST HIGHLY IMPACTED BY THE HIV/AIDS EPIDEMIC TO BRING IN NEW SOCIAL MEDIA AND MARKETING PARTNERS FOR THE CDC?S LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER (TOGETHER) CAMPAIGN.EACH LETTER IN THE TITLE ?REACH? SIGNIFIES AN IMPORTANT PRINCIPLE THAT NMAC AND ITS PARTNERS IN PROJECT REACH WILL EMPHASIZE IN MESSAGING AND CAMPAIGNS FOR TOGETHER: RESOURCES FOR PREVENTION, EMPOWERING INDIVIDUALS TO TAKE ACTION, ACCESSING ALL THE TOOLS FOR HIV PREVENTION, CHALLENGING THE COMMUNITY, AND HELPING EACH OTHER REDUCE THE IMPACT OF HIV IN OUR COMMUNITIES. PROJECT REACH WILL IDENTIFY AND RECRUIT PARTNERS THAT LAY OUTSIDE THE TRADITIONAL WORLD OF HIV/AIDS ADVOCACY, SUCH AS ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE ETHNIC/RACIAL, REGIONAL, RELIGIOUS, PROFESSIONAL, OR OTHER SOCIAL PURPOSES THAT DO NOT CENTER ON HIV BUT WHOSE CONSTITUENCIES INCLUDE INDIVIDUALS FROM PROJECT REACH?S THREE COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS: BLACK/AFRICAN AMERICAN, HISPANIC/LATINX, AND PEOPLE WITH HIV (PWH). OVER FIVE YEARS, PROJECT REACH WILL BRING 100 OR MORE NEW PARTNERS (AT LEAST 20 ANNUALLY) TO THE CDC?S TOGETHER CAMPAIGN TO EXTEND ITS REACH THESE COMMUNITIES THAT ARE CRUCIAL IN THE EFFORT TO PREVENT HIV INFECTION.

NATIONAL BLACK JUSTICE COALITION ENHANCING STRATEGIC HIV COMMUNICATIONS AMONG BLACK MSM AND TRANSGENDER WOMEN THROUGH STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS - 1. PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARYIN ORDER TO ACCOMPLISH THE AFOREMENTIONED PROJECT PERIOD OUTCOMES AND ACHIEVE MAXIMUM IMPACT, NBJC WILL UTILIZE LEVERAGE ITS EXISTING ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE, NETWORKS, AND COMMUNICATIONS PLATFORMS TO IMPLEMENT THE STRATEGIES AND ACTIVITIES FOR BOTH CATEGORY A (DIGITAL AND SOCIAL MEDIA) AND B (EVENTS).  GIVEN THAT WE ARE CONSIDERING CATEGORY A AND B AS INTEGRATED ACTIVITIES, WE WILL PRESENT AN INTEGRATED APPROACH TO OUR STRATEGIES AND OUTCOMES. NBJC IS UNIQUELY POSITIONED, AS THE NATION?S ONLY CIVIL RIGHTS ORGANIZATION WORKING AT THE INTERSECTION OF RACIAL EQUITY AND LGBTQIA+ EQUALITY, TO LEVERAGE CDC MESSAGES AND MATERIALS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF BLACK LEADERS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT SERVE AND SUPPORT BLACK COMMUNITIES, ENGAGED IN EFFORTS TO INCREASE HIV/AIDS AWARENESS AND STIGMA REDUCTION.  SINCE 2003, NBJC HAS PROVIDED LEADERSHIP AT THE INTERSECTION OF NATIONAL CIVIL RIGHTS GROUPS AND LGBT ORGANIZATIONS. NBJC HAS SPENT NEARLY THE LAST DECADE TESTING AND IMPROVING WAYS TO DISSEMINATE CDC INFORMED MESSAGES AND MATERIALS IN WAYS THAT HAVE RESULTED IN MEANINGFUL AND MEASURABLE SHIFTS IN CONVERSATIONS ABOUT AND ACTIONS CONCERNING HIV/AIDS IN DIVERSE BLACK COMMUNITIES. NBJC BRINGS VOICE, TAKES ACTION AND BUILDS NETWORKS TO EMPOWER BLACK LGBTQ+/SGL PEOPLE TO BE CREDIBLE AGENTS OF POSITIVE CHANGE, WORKING TO IMPROVE THE SOCIAL, POLITICAL, AND OVERALL HEALTH AND WELLNESS OF THE BLACK LGBTQ+/SGL COMMUNITY. NBJC WILL UTILIZE ITS ESTABLISHED NATIONAL REACH THROUGH EARNED MEDIA, SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS, GRASSROOTS NETWORKS AND COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIPS, IN ORDER TO SUPPORT THE CDC?S LET'S STOP HIV TOGETHER EFFORTS TO DISSEMINATE HIV PREVENTION MESSAGING AND COMMUNICATION WITHIN BLACK COMMUNITIES?PARTICULARLY AMONG MSM AND TRANSGENDER WOMEN?AND TO IMPLEMENT NATIONAL ENGAGEMENT EFFORTS THAT FOCUS ON HIV PREVENTION, AWARENESS, TESTING, AND CARE. BY THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD, NBJC?S EFFORT WILL SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE CDC?S ENDING THE HIV EPIDEMIC: A PLAN FOR AMERICA (EHE), AND MAXIMIZE THE EFFECTIVENESS AND REACH OF THE CDC?S LET'S STOP HIV TOGETHER CAMPAIGN AND OTHER HIV PREVENTION MESSAGING. BY THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD, THE NATIONAL BLACK JUSTICE COALITION WILL DEMONSTRATE MEASURABLE PROGRESS TOWARD ADDRESSING THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES:1. INCREASE EXPOSURE TO CDC?S LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER CAMPAIGN MATERIALS AND MESSAGES AMONG THE BLACK COMMUNITY, PARTICULARLY MSM AND TRANSGENDER WOMEN.2. INCREASE HIV-RELATED INFORMATION SEEKING BEHAVIORS IN THE BLACK COMMUNITY, PARTICULARLY AMONG BLACK MSM AND TRANSGENDER WOMEN.3. INCREASE PARTNER ENGAGEMENT WITH CDC?S LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER MATERIALS AND MESSAGES AMONG ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS SERVING BLACK MSM AND TRANSGENDER WOMEN.4. INCREASE CROSS-COMMUNITY SUPPORT FOR HIV PREVENTION, TESTING, AND REFERRAL SERVICES IN THE BLACK COMMUNITY, PARTICULARLY MSM AND TRANSGENDER WOMEN.5. INCREASE HIV-RELATED COMMUNICATION AMONG ENGAGED PARTNERS AND NETWORKS IN THE BLACK COMMUNITY, PARTICULARLY MSM AND TRANSGENDER WOMEN.

NOTHING FOR US WITHOUT US : EXPANDING THE REACH, BUILDING PARTNERSHIP ENGAGEMENT AND CROSS-COMMUNITY SUPPORT FOR THE CDC'S NATIONAL COMMUNICATIONS PLAN - WITH THE LAUNCH OF THE ENDING THE HIV EPIDEMIC INITIATIVE LAUNCHED NATIONALLY IN 2019 WE SAW A PUSH TO ENSURE COMMUNITIES THAT DID NOT HAVE ACCESS TO PREVENTATIVE MEASURES AT SCALE; WITH A PARTICULAR FOCUS ON COMMUNITIES WITH THE HIGHEST RATES OF NEW DIAGNOSIS. HOWEVER, LESS THAN A YEAR INTO THE INITIATIVE COVID 19 BEGAN TO SPREAD AND WITHIN A FEW MONTHS WE SAW THE SAME DISPARATE IMPACTS ON BLACK, LATINX AND INDIGIOUNOUS COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE UNITED STATES, WITH A PARTICULAR EMPHASIS ON THOSE WHO WERE ALREADY IMMUNE COMPROMISED SUCH AS INDIVIDUALS LIVING WITH HIV AND THOSE WHO ARE CONSIDERED PRIORITY POPULATIONS FOR HIV PREVENTION, MEN WHO HAVE SEX WITH MEN, SEX WORKERS, INTRAVENOUS DRUG USERS, AND TRANSWOMEN.  THE FACT THAT HIV IS STILL AN EPIDEMIC POINTS TO THE IMPORTANCE OF HAVING AN UNDERSTANDING FOR SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH AND HOW FOCUSING ALL EFFORTS ON ONE SPHERE DOES NOT RESULT IN REDUCTION OF TRANSMISSION OR MITIGATION OF HARM. LET'S STOP HIV TOGETHER  MATERIALS WILL BE UTILIZED TO INFORM OUR COMMUNITIES OF PREVENTION, TESTING AND LINKAGE TO CARE RESOURCES WHILE IN A SPACE OF CONNECTION TO ENSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS HAVE HOUSING, FOOD, CLEAN WATER, EMPLOYMENT AND ACCESS TO A COMMUNITY IN WHICH THEY ARE A MEMBER IN AN EFFORT TO REDUCE SOCIAL ISOLATION AND DEPRESSION. TRANS EQUITY CONSULTING IS A FIRM COMPRISED OF 6 BLACK AND LATINX TRANSGENDER AND NON BINARY INDIVIDUALS WITH A COMBINED 20 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE WORKING TO END STIGMA, UPLIFT COMMUNITY, AND PROVIDE ACCESS TO RESOURCES IN REAL TIME TO COMBAT SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH WITH AN EMPHASIS ON HEALTHCARE ACCESS FOR BLACK AND LATINX TRANSGENDER AND QUEER COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE UNITED STATES AND LATIN AMERICA. WE ARE CURRENTLY SUPPORTING 15 ORGANIZATIONS IN PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND CONTENT DISSEMINATION ACROSS 10 JURISDICTIONS. TRANS EQUITY CONSULTING APPROACH TO OUR WORK IS HOLISTIC AND INTERSECTIONAL RECOGNIZING THAT WE CAN NOT PARSE OUT ONE DECISION MADE BY AN INDIVIDUAL  FROM THE FULL CONTEXT OF THEIR LIFE AND SO WE MUST BE PROVIDING AND LINKING TO INFORMATION, RESOURCES AND ASSISTANCE ACROSS MULTIPLE NEEDS. WITH COVID 19 AND THE SHIFT TO A VIRTUAL FORMAT WE HAVE BEEN ABLE TO EXPAND OUR COMMUNITY CONNECTION NOT JUST ACROSS ZIP CODE BUT TO INCLUDE INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO MAY HAVE OTHERWISE BEEN UNABLE TO ATTEND IN PERSON EVENTS.

PARTNERING AND COMMUNICATING TOGETHER - PROJECT TITLE:PARTNERING AND COMMUNICATING TOGETHERAPPLICANT NAME: REALISTIC EDUCATION IN ACTION COALITION TO FOSTER HEALTH ? REACH LAADDRESS:1400 E. OLYMPIC BLVD #240, LOS ANGELES, CA 90021DIRECTOR:MIGUEL BUJANDA, EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR CONTACT PHONE: (213) 622-1650 EXT 101E?MAIL ADDRESS:MIGUEL@REACHLA.ORG WEB SITE ADDRESS:WWW.REACHLA.ORGFUNDS REQUESTED:$200,000 PER YEAR ($1,000,000-5 YEARS)REALISTIC EDUCATION IN ACTION COALITION TO FOSTER HEALTH (REACH LA) IS APPLYING FOR PS21-2104 PARTNERING AND COMMUNICATING TOGETHER TO DISSEMINATE HIV COMMUNICATION RESOURCES VIA DIGITAL AND SOCIAL MEDIA CHANNELS TO INCREASE HIV AWARENESS, REDUCE NEW HIV INFECTIONS, AND IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES AMONG LATINX AND BLACK GAY/BISEXUAL MEN AND TRANSGENDER WOMEN, AND PEOPLE LIVING WITH HIV IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY, A PHASE 1 ENDING THE HIV EPIDEMIC INITIATIVE JURISDICTION. REACH LA, A YOUTH-FOCUSED ORGANIZATION, WILL PARTNER WITH 30 BLACK AND LATINX INFLUENCERS IN THE HOUSE AND BALL, LATINO PARTY, ARTS, AND ENTERTAINMENT SCENES REACHING OVER 2.5 MILLION VIA SOCIAL MEDIA AND DIGITAL ADVERTISING YEARLY.  ON A YEARLY BASIS, REACH LA WILL CONDUCT 145 SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS, HOST 12 SOCIAL MEDIA EVENTS COHOSTED WITH BLACK AND LATINX LGBTQ INFLUENCERS, PLACEMENT OF 140 DIGITAL ADS ACROSS DIFFERENT SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS, PARTNER WITH 20 COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, AND PUBLISH 5 DIGITAL ARTICLES ON WEBSITES AND BLOGS. THE PARTNERSHIP WITH IHEART MEDIA FOR DIGITAL, RADIO, AND SOCIAL MEDIA WILL LEND ITS MAINSTREAM MEDIA INFLUENCE TO FURTHER REACH A LARGER AUDIENCE AS WELL AS CONNECT VIEWERS AND LISTENERS TO CDC FOR RESOURCES.REACH LA HAS ESTABLISHED A STRONG SOCIAL MEDIA PRESENCE AND ENGAGEMENT GEOTARGETING AND REACHING THE DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES AREA (SPA 4), SOUTH LA (SPA 6), SAN FERNANDO VALLEY (SPA 2), AND SAN GABRIEL VALLEY (SPA 3).  FOLLOWERS AND PARTICIPANTS COME FROM SURROUNDING AREAS INCLUDING RIVERSIDE, SANTA ANA, AND POMONA. VIRTUALLY, PARTICIPANTS LOG INTO ZOOM WORKSHOPS AND DAN CE CLASSES FROM CHICAGO, LAS VEGAS, ORLANDO, AND MIAMI. AS OF MARCH 2021, DIGITAL AND SOCIAL MEDIA DATA REPORTED A TOTAL OF 3K FOLLOWERS ON INSTAGRAM 3.4K ON FACEBOOK. THERE IS CONSISTENT POSTING, ENGAGEMENT, AND KNOWLEDGE OF SOCIAL MEDIA ALGORITHMS THAT HAVE RESULTED IN TREMENDOUS ORGANIC SOCIAL MEDIA GROWTH. ADDITIONALLY, REACH LA HAS ESTABLISHED SYSTEMS TO RESPOND TO POSTS, TAGS, DIRECT MESSAGES, AND COMMENTS. REACH LA?S PS21-2104 SOCIAL MEDIA TEAM IS COMPRISED OF YOUNG AND TALENTED INFLUENCERS IN THE HOUSE AND BALL, MUSIC, LIFESTYLE WHO TOGETHER REACH 500,000 FOLLOWERS.  WITH A GREATER ONLINE PRESENCE AS A RESULT OF COVID-19, REACH LA HAD 1250+ INDIVIDUALS ATTEND THE VIRTUAL EVENTS, 650+ ATTEND VIRTUAL DANCE CLASSES, 535 YOUNG PEOPLE TESTED FOR HIV, 20 NEW POSITIVES IDENTIFIED, AND 100% LINKED TO CARE.REACH LA WILL UTILIZE SPROUTS SOCIAL FOR SOCIAL MEDIA MANAGEMENT AND DATA ANALYTICS THAT PROVIDES CROSS-CHANNEL SOCIAL MEDIA ANALYTICS, TREND MANAGEMENT, STREAMLINES AND SCALES POSTS AND ENGAGEMENT, MEASURES AND OPTIMIZES POSTS AND ADS. DATA ANALYTICS THAT INCLUDES NUMBER OF FOLLOWERS, NUMBER OF SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS, NUMBER OF ENGAGEMENT, NUMBER OF IMPRESSIONS FOR AD PLACEMENTS, NUMBER OF BLOG POSTS AND ENGAGEMENTS, NUMBER OF SEARCHES AND LINKAGES TO HIV SERVICES WILL BE REVIEWED MONTHLY TO IMPROVE PROGRAM PERFORMANCE.

NATIONAL HISPANIC MEDICAL ASSOCIATION PARTNERING AND COMMUNICATING TOGETHER - PROJECT ABSTRACTHIV/AIDS CONTINUES TO BE A SIGNIFICANT PUBLIC HEALTH CHALLENGE IN THE US. THE ANNUAL NUMBER OF NEW DIAGNOSES DECREASED 7% FROM 2014 TO 2018, BUT HISPANICS/LATINOS ACCOUNTED FOR 27% OF THE NEW HIV DIAGNOSES. AS THE LARGEST AND FASTEST-GROWING MINORITY IN THE US, COUPLED WITH DISPROPORTIONATE RATES OF HIV/AIDS, HISPANICS ARE CRUCIALLY IMPORTANT TO PRIORITIZE IN HIV PREVENTION AND CARE EFFORTS, ESPECIALLY AMONG MSM AND TRANSGENDER WOMEN. THE NATIONAL HISPANIC MEDICAL ASSOCIATION (NHMA) PROPOSAL FOR PARTNERING AND COMMUNICATING TOGETHER (CATEGORIES A AND B) WILL INCREASE HIV AWARENESS, REDUCE NEW HIV INFECTIONS, IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES AND SUPPORT CDC?S LET?S STOP HIV TOGETHER (TOGETHER) CAMPAIGN.THE PURPOSE OF THE NHMA PROJECT IS TO MAXIMIZE THE EFFECTIVENESS AND REACH OF THE TOGETHER CAMPAIGN BY STRATEGICALLY DISSEMINATING HIV PREVENTION DIGITAL AND SOCIAL MEDIA MESSAGING AND COMMUNICATIONS TO THE HISPANIC COMMUNITY, AS WELL AS IMPLEMENTING EVENTS IN KEY U.S. JURISDICTIONS THAT FOCUS ON HIV AWARENESS AND PREVENTION. NHMA WILL HOLD 10 EVENTS PER YEAR AT THE NHMA ANNUAL CONFERENCE AND CHAPTER FORUMS IN SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA, NEW YORK CITY, PUERTO RICO, AND KEY AREAS WITH PARTNERS TO REDUCE NEW HIV INFECTIONS AMONG HISPANICS AT HIGHEST RISK, INCREASE REFERRALS TO HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS AND CREATE IMPROVED HEALTH OUTCOMES FOR HISPANICS WITH HIV.   SHORT-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASE EXPOSURE TO THE CDC?S HIV CAMPAIGN MATERIALS AND MESSAGES AND HIV-RELATED INFORMATION-SEEKING BEHAVIORS AMONG HISPANICS DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED BY HIV, WITH HIV AND HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS; AND INCREASE PARTNER ENGAGEMENT. THESE WILL LEAD TO INTERMEDIATE OUTCOMES THAT INCLUDE INCREASE CROSS-COMMUNITY SUPPORT AND FAVORABLE ATTITUDES FOR AND INCREASE HIV PREVENTION, TESTING, AND REFERRAL STRATEGIES; INCREASE HIV-RELATED COMMUNICATION AMONG PARTNERS, INCREASE REFERRALS AND LINKAGE TO CARE AMONG HISPANICS WITH HIV, AND INCREASE ADOPTION OF HIV SCREENING, PREVENTI ON, AND CARE AND TREATMENT RECOMMENDATIONS BY HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS. THE PROJECT WILL LEVERAGE NHMA?S EXISTING NETWORKS, ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURES, AND COMMUNICATION PLATFORMS USING EVIDENCE-BASED APPROACHES THAT ACKNOWLEDGE THE DIVERSITY IN THE US HISPANIC COMMUNITY, INCLUDING DIFFERENCES IN MEDIA USE AND TRUST OF HEALTH INFORMATION SOURCES. A MASS MEDIA STRATEGY, INCLUDING AD PLACEMENTS AND BROADCASTS, WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY ONLINE DISSEMINATION ACTIVITIES, SOCIAL MEDIA STRATEGY, EMAIL COMMUNICATIONS, TAILORED NHMA AND PARTNER WEBSITES, UPDATED HISPANIC HEALTH PORTAL, AND A VIRTUAL HISPANIC HIV COMMUNITY OF PRACTICE. THESE STRATEGIES WILL BE COMPLEMENTED BY FACE-TO-FACE COMMUNICATION AND DISSEMINATION AT NHMA?S ANNUAL CONFERENCE (INCLUDING EDUCATIONAL SESSIONS AND NETWORKING ACTIVITIES), LOCAL CHAPTER FORUMS, WEBINARS OF MESSAGING OF THE TOGETHER CAMPAIGN. FINALLY, NHMA WILL WORK WITH NEW PARTNERS. NHMA PROPOSES A SPECIFIC EVALUATION STUDY TO EXAMINE IN GREATER DEPTH THE IMPACT OF CDC?S CAMPAIGN MESSAGING ON THE PARTICIPANTS? AWARENESS, ATTITUDES, AND BEHAVIORS, AND WHETHER THIS TRANSLATES INTO ORGANIZATIONAL AND COMMUNITY-WIDE CHANGES IN THEIR LOCAL AREAS.   NHMA SERVES AS THE LEADING NATIONAL RESOURCE AND ADVOCATES TO IMPROVE HISPANIC HEALTH. NHMA WILL BRING A SUBSTANTIAL NETWORK OF COMMUNITY AND PROFESSIONAL ORGANIZATIONS, A DOCUMENTED HISTORY OF IMPACTING POLICY AND INFRASTRUCTURE FOR IMPROVED HISPANIC HEALTH, KNOWLEDGE OF AND EXPERIENCE WORKING WITH FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, AND THE NATIONAL REACH TO EFFECTIVELY EXTEND CDC?S NATIONAL TOGETHER CAMPAIGN TO INCREASE HIV AWARENESS, REDUCE NEW HIV INFECTIONS AND IMPROVE OUTCOMES AMONG HISPANICS.
